alert.note: Alert for Koochiching; St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 18 at 5:56PM CDT until August 18 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Minnesota and northeast Minnesota, including the following counties, in north central Minnesota, Koochiching. In northeast Minnesota, St. Louis. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 554 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour is expected as storms move slowly across the area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ely, Lake Vermilion, Nett Lake, Orr, Ash Lake, Buyck, Cusson, Pelican Lake, Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness Near Trout Lake, Burntside Lake, White Iron Lake, western Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, Echo Lake, Black Duck Lake, Trout Lake, Bois Forte Band Nett Lake Area, Cummings Lake, Big Moose Lake and Shagawa Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
